background: A pharmacy produces acne and anti-bacterial creams in two factories with different production rates and requires a certain amount of base gel per hour for each factory. The pharmacy aims to meet minimum production requirements for both creams with a limited supply of base gel.
constraints: A maximum of TotalBaseGel units of base gel is available
At least MinAcneCream units of acne cream must be produced in total
At least MinAntibacterialCream units of anti-bacterial cream must be produced in total
Number of hours factory 1 operates is non-negative
Number of hours factory 2 operates is non-negative
objective: Minimize the total hours of operation across both factories
description: A pharmacy has two factories, factory 1 and factory 2, where they make acne cream and anti-bacterial cream. Factory 1 produces \param{AcneFactory1} units of acne cream and \param{AntibacterialFactory1} units of anti-bacterial cream per hour. Factory 2 produces \param{AcneFactory2} units of acne cream and \param{AntibacterialFactory2} units of anti-bacterial cream per hour. Factory 1 requires \param{BaseGelFactory1} units of base gel per hour while factory 2 requires \param{BaseGelFactory2} units of base gel per hour. The pharmacy has available \param{TotalBaseGel} units of base gel. Further, they must make at least \param{MinAcneCream} units of acne cream and \param{MinAntibacterialCream} units of anti-bacterial cream. How many hours should each factory be run to minimize the total time needed?

parameters.definition: Quantity of acne cream produced by factory 1 per hour
Quantity of anti-bacterial cream produced by factory 1 per hour
Quantity of acne cream produced by factory 2 per hour
Quantity of anti-bacterial cream produced by factory 2 per hour
Base gel used by factory 1 per hour
Base gel used by factory 2 per hour
Total available units of base gel
Minimum required units of acne cream to be produced
Minimum required units of anti-bacterial cream to be produced
